page.title: 14A TYPICAL DAY
page.content: Joan Burns::Widow::Otterton resident:: :-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:-:- My day began at 7-30 a.m. with a cup of tea in bed-listening to the B.B.C. news,toast and home made marmalade, reading newspaper and mail_delivered daily. After breakfast, walked to the Butchers, past the Blacksmith's to the P.O. to collect weekly pension,Â£36.78 Bought loaf of brown bread from the Bakery(49p). Returned home and cooked mid_day meal_pork chop, apple sauce, garden vegetables, strawberries & clotted cream. P.M. Drove to Budleigh Salterton, went to bank and Library. Returning to Otterton, called on my daughter and 3 little grand_daughters, just home from the Village School. Watched Wimbledon on T.V. before going to a Barbecue at Bicton Park with the W.I. And so to bed with a book before 'lights out'.
